item.title: Handing People Puzzles
item.description: We’re a com­mu­nity that is es­pe­cially vuln­er­a­ble to nerd sniping, as com­mu­ni­ties go. I’m fond of par­tak­ing in a lit­tle nerd sniping my­self. While the origi­nal xkcd paints this pas­time in a mal­i­cious light, I ar­gue that this is in fact a great thing in gen­eral. One of my fa­vori......

item.title: Notes from Dopamine Detoxing
item.description: [Epistemic sta­tus: I’m not a neu­ro­scien­tist nor any kind of med­i­cal nor biolog­i­cal pro­fes­sional. item.title: Absorbing Your Friends’ Powers
item.description: Motivation Richard Ham­ming was a math­e­mat­i­cian who worked at Bell Labs dur­ing the 1940s-1970s. He had a habit of sit­ting down with sci­en­tists in other fields and ask­ing them “What are the im­por­tant prob­lems of your field?” After they ex­plained their field’s most im­por­tant open pro......
